Name: The Leaf Nose
Ingredients: 40 ml Bacardi Carta Blanca Superior White Rum
10 ml Dutch Cacao white crème de cacao
5 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and fine strain into chilled glass.
Review: “This drink was inspired by the great classic sours such as the ‘Mulata’, ‘Daisy de Santiago’, ‘The Last Word’ & ‘20th Century Cocktail’. The name and story draw from the species of bat that lived in the rafters of Don Facundo’s first distillery and inspired the BACARDÍ bat logo, a symbol of family, prosperity and health.”
History: New Zealand BACARDÍ Legacy 2014 winning cocktail created by Guy Jacobson at Charley Noble Eatery & Bar, Wellington, New Zealand.
Nutrition: One serving of The Leaf Nose contains 154 calories
